page.title: 07HIGHER EDUCATION IN THE AREA
page.content: TWO LAKES FISHERIES-BRAISHFIELD Principal-Mr.Alex Behrendt A fish farm and angling complex first opened in 1948. For the last 20 years, environmental courses for university students throughout the world have been held here, in a complex which comprises 14 acres of lakes within a total of 33 acres. Students from the nearby Hampshire College of Agriculture use the facilities as part of a course on gamekeeping. JERMYNS HOUSE-BRAISHFIELD Purchased by the late Sir Harold Hillier in 1953 and handed over to Hampshire County Council in 1977 as part of a charitable trust involving Hillier Arboretum, the property is at the moment being converted into flats for use by overseas students coming to this country to study arboreculture.
